content.text:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                  WE WERE RAISED UNDER GREY SKIES - JP Cooper
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tabbed by:ndermawan


Tuning: Half step down - for this version
        Album version is in STANDARD tuning

Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hn6ykeBIQKw

This is his acoustic version, not sure if the album is a step up in pitch or not.

Lovely song, and this video by Christian Tierney is 
what made me discover his music in the first place!

Chills on the last chorus for sure  :O

------------
Chords Used:
------------

    [ch]Em[/ch]  [ch]F#[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch] or [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]Cmaj7[/ch] [ch]Bm7[/ch]  [ch]Am7[/ch]  | *[ch]Em7[/ch] *[ch]Bm7[/ch] *[ch]Am7[/ch] | *[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  X 
e|--0-------3----3---------2---0----|--7-------------|-----------------------|
B|--0-------3----3----5----3---1----|--8----7----5---|---8-----7-------------|
G|--0-------0----4----4----2---0----|--7----7----5---|---9-------------------|
D|--2-------0----5----5----4---2----|--9----7----5---|---9-----5-------------|
A|--2-------2----5----3----2---0----|--7----x----x---|---10----7-------------|
E|--0---2---3----3------------------|-------7----5---|---8-------------------|

-During the *[ch]Em7[/ch] chords in chorus he hammers on to the 10th fret high e string
 with his pinky.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ch]G[/ch]                                  [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]Bm7[/ch]

          [ch]Em[/ch]                       ([ch]F#[/ch])    [ch]G[/ch]
Oh, and - father led with examples
[ch]G[/ch]                                  [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]Bm7[/ch]
Of how to draw beauty from pain
                    [ch]Em[/ch]                          ([ch]F#[/ch])    [ch]G[/ch]
So I found a thousand spring-times in her eyes
[ch]G[/ch]                                  [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]Bm7[/ch]

[Chorus]

[ch]G[/ch]                                  [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]Bm7[/ch]

                           [ch]Em[/ch]                           ([ch]F#[/ch])    [ch]G[/ch]

[ch]G[/ch]                        [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]Bm7[/ch]

content.text:
The intro and recurring riff on E goes something like this:

  [ch]E[/ch]                               [ch]A[/ch]
e|------0-------0-------0-------0---------0----------------------|
B|----------------------------------------0----------------------|
G|----1-------4---4-6-4-----------------2------------------------|
D|--------4-6-------------6-4-2-------2--------------------------|
A|--------------------------------0------------------------------|
E|0--------------------------------------------------------------|

and repeats.

[ch]E[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] [ch]E[/ch] [ch]A[/ch]

name: Hometown Battlefield
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
[Intro]
[ch]G[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]A[/ch]

   [ch]G[/ch]                                 [ch]D[/ch]
He got home from the service, as the spring began its turn
[ch]G[/ch]           [ch]Em[/ch]      [ch]Bm[/ch]
Twelve long months away
   [ch]G[/ch]                              [ch]D[/ch]
He folded up his uniform with the medals tucked inside
        [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]A[/ch]
Started living for today


        [ch]G[/ch]                               [ch]D[/ch]
But the present could not find him, nor could his wife and kids
       [ch]G[/ch]         [ch]Em[/ch]     [ch]Bm[/ch]
He was there but he was gone
[ch]G[/ch]                           [ch]D[/ch]
Soon his only comfort was a bottle and his gun
          [ch]G[/ch]                  [ch]A[/ch]
Something right that went so wrong

[Chorus]
        [ch]Bm[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]
And the silence keeps on coming as the movie plays again
        [ch]Bm[/ch]                [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]
You can smell that yellow dust and death hanging on the wind
       [ch]Bm[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]D[/ch]            [ch]A[/ch]
And we thought the war was over but the headlines do reveal
     [ch]D[/ch]                                 [ch]A[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]          [ch]D[/ch]
That another soldier died today on the hometown battlefield

[Break]
  [ch]G[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]     [ch]Em[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]     [ch]A[/ch]     [ch]A[/ch]

[Verse]
   [ch]G[/ch]                                    [ch]D[/ch]
He sits outside the courthouse with his pant legs tucked away
    [ch]G[/ch]      [ch]Em[/ch]        [ch]Bm[/ch]
And no one knows his name
[ch]G[/ch]                                        [ch]D[/ch]
One wrong step there in the sand put him where he is today
[ch]G[/ch]                 [ch]A[/ch]
One more just the same

[ch]G[/ch]                                  [ch]D[/ch]
All his memories live there in the space below his knees
[ch]G[/ch]         [ch]Em[/ch]     [ch]Bm[/ch]
Back when he was whole
         [ch]G[/ch]                 [ch]D[/ch]
But that IED didn't just relieve him of his legs
   [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]
It blew apart his soul

[Chorus]
        [ch]Bm[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]
And the silence keeps on coming as the movie plays again
        [ch]Bm[/ch]                [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]
You can smell that yellow dust and death flying) on the wind
       [ch]Bm[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]D[/ch]            [ch]A[/ch]
And we thought the war was over but the headlines do reveal
     [ch]D[/ch]                                 [ch]A[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]          [ch]D[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]
That another soldier died today on the hometown battlefield

[Verse]
[ch]A[/ch]                                    [ch]G[/ch]                  [ch]D[/ch]
If you're wearing loafers, you ain't walked the burning sand
    [ch]A[/ch]                            [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]
And you ain't never had to shoot another livin' man
         [ch]Em[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]             [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]D[/ch]
It don't matter if we won, it don't matter if we lost
          [ch]Em[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]A[/ch]      [ch]A[/ch]
They were following their orders, no matter the cost


     [ch]G[/ch]                                  [ch]D[/ch]
So I remember what they've given when I see my flag unfurled
[ch]G[/ch]     [ch]Em[/ch]         [ch]Bm[/ch]
Free against the sky
        [ch]G[/ch]                                  [ch]D[/ch]
And the way we seem to lose them when they get back to the world
    [ch]G[/ch]               [ch]A[/ch]
Can someone tell me why

[Chorus]
        [ch]Bm[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]
And the silence keeps on coming as the movie plays again
        [ch]Bm[/ch]                [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]
You can smell that yellow dust and death hanging on the wind
       [ch]Bm[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]D[/ch]            [ch]A[/ch]
And we thought the war was over but the headlines do reveal
     [ch]D[/ch]                                 [ch]A[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]          [ch]D[/ch]
That another soldier died today on the hometown battlefield
       [ch]Bm[/ch]              [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]D[/ch]            [ch]A[/ch]
Yes we pray the war is over but the headlines do reveal
     [ch]D[/ch]                                 [ch]A[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]          [ch]D[/ch]
That another soldier died today on the hometown battlefield

[Outro]
